oai_dc:dc.dc:title: OXOVANADIUM(V) SCHIFF-BASE COMPLEXES OF TRISHYDROXYMETHYLAMINOMETHANE WITH SALICYLALDEHYDE AND ITS DERIVATIVES - SYNTHESIS, CHARACTERIZATION AND REDOX REACTIVITY
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: ASGEDOM, G
SREEDHARA, A
RAO, CP
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ascophyllum-nodosum
vanadium
spectroscopy
chemistry
model
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Five vanadium complexes possessing the VO3+ motif with NO4 coordination have been synthesized and characterized by H-1 and C-13 NMR, UV-Vis, FTIR and cyclic voltammetry. These complexes favour trigonal bipyramidal geometry. In DMF solution, complexes 1 and 5 have shown reversible redox behaviour in the presence of L-ascorbic acid or L-cysteine ethyl ester in air as monitored by electronic absorption and EPR studies.
